hackathon-description-text: HackThePack is a 24 hour student run Hackathon open to all Northeastern students, taking place April 7-8. Our goal is to bring together about 100 students from a wide array of technical backgrounds in order to encourage students to collaborate across disciplines and tackle complex issues facing Northeastern students and the world around them.
hackathon-eligibility: Must be actively enrolled at Northeastern University, either graduate or undergraduate. Team sizes are capped at 4 people.
hackathon-requirements: Include a document describing how to use your program.
hackathon-rules:

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The grand prize is a 3D printed trophy, a congratulatory handshake, and leftover food.
A 3D printed trophy, a congratulatory handshake, and leftover food.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=370 Huntington Ave, Boston, MA 02115, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: More than just throwing a new wrapper on an existing API, hackers approached a problem in a different way, leading to a different, unique, or innovative project.
Project serves a practical or functional purpose, and could potentially be used by a public audience.

hackathon-description-header: A 24 hour hackathon for Northeasten students
